teslaxgopro.title: Tesla x Go Pro
teslaxgopro.desc: salut thadd√© tu n'as pas √©crit le contenu de ce paragraphe, des bisous.

layouts.title: Self-flying drone üì∏
layouts.subtitle: Intro
paragraphs: Our mission was to redesign, as a team of 10, the overall Tesla interface, including the app, the Cluster, the Watch app and the dashboard. The tricky part was that we had to find a brand and imagine a partnership between that brand and Tesla.

We chose Go Pro. And the fun part of that project is that we could find and design a feature that would make sense with the according brand. So we imagined a way to launch a drone and start recording, while the car‚Äôs driving itself.

layouts.title: Building the future üî≠
layouts.subtitle: Philosophy
paragraphs: I loved the idea of designing for a screen I‚Äôm not used to design for. Besides, Go Pro and Tesla are companies with strong branding that actually somehow matched. It didn‚Äôt feel like I was designing a fake interface, I truly cared about how futuristic that actually looked like.‚Ä®
I would not even be suprised if we could actually soon launch a drone from a car we‚Äôre not even driving, and do nothing but see this drone follow the car and shoot a film.

layouts.title: Sitting in the front seat üöò
layouts.subtitle: Learnings
paragraphs: Designing for a context such as this one is quite interesting since there are a lot of things you can‚Äôt really do for security matters. You need to come back to the core of design and think deeply about each feature you‚Äôre building, and put yourself in the front seat.
For instance, we added scrolling on the main screen, and we then learned it was somehow forbidden to do that in Europe. ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

layouts.title: Consistency‚Äôs the key üîë
layouts.subtitle: Learnings
paragraphs: If there‚Äôs one thing we learned from this exercice is how hard being consistent between platforms can be. Designing an Watch App, a Phone app, a car dashboard and cluster was a challenge consistency wise. Especially when you‚Äôre working with a big team on the same design.
So we build a UI kit everybody in the team could refer to, and used Abstract as a tool for design management. It all worked out perfect.

weekmeal.title: Weekmeal, School Project
weekmeal.desc: finally finding a good idea of what to cook for dinner tonight

layouts.title: About the project üçó
layouts.subtitle: Intro
paragraphs: Weekmeal is a project that came to live at HETIC, as we had only one week to conceive, create and develop an Android and iOs app on the theme we wanted.

We chose to create an app that would help one find ideas of things to cook for a week. The user could choose the number of meals he wanted ideas for and the app would learn to know its user and offer a variety of meals that would suit his taste.

layouts.title: Features and AI üí°
layouts.subtitle: Product
paragraphs: We were asked by our teacher to use AI to somehow add value to our idea. Therefore, we added individualization to our product through the way the recipes are shown to the user.
Throughout the weeks and months during which the user‚Äôs using the app, we create a profile that is his only, and show only the recipes that we‚Äôre pretty sure he will like.

slides.title: Step one
slides.desc: Giving the detail of your eventual diet and desires

slides.title: Step one
slides.desc: Giving the detail of your eventual diet and desires

slides.title: Step one
slides.desc: Giving the detail of your eventual diet and desires

layouts.title: Adding value to the app üåü
layouts.subtitle: Service Design
paragraphs: The main issue when you‚Äôre designing an idea that is quite common is to find a good business value. Among those was AI, but also the idea to rather than only design the app, try to design the service behind that.

So we decided to go beyond giving only recipes according to your taste. The app also gives you the estimated budget for the ingredients (calculated with the prices of the place you live in), the closest store and the map to go there. We managed to design the full scope of the situation our users ar in.

layouts.title: Design, outside of the box üì¶
layouts.subtitle: Learnings
paragraphs: It‚Äôs quite fun to design an app that a lot of people already had the idea of. We learned that only designing what you first think of doesn‚Äôt lead anywhere. You need to learn from the users, think outside of the box and redesign the whole service to create something interesting.

Only dealing with finding a recipe idea isn‚Äôt interesting. The goal of the app was to design everything, from the moment you‚Äôre asking yourself what you want for dinner and the moment you‚Äôve finished eating.
